item.title: Comment on The Stork has launched! by Drey
item.dc:creator: Drey
item.description:
Well, I have your cold medicine addled noggin to thank for reminding me to add contact information to the site! I got so wrapped up in the launch of The Stork that I forgot to add that page.
Stork wallpaper can definitely happen. Give me some time to put that together.
Yes, I have considered a Facebook page for The Stork. Originally, I wanted the official Stork site to be the main source of Stork info so I wan't sure I wanted a Facebook page as well. But it wouldn't be too hard to set up a Facebook page that pulls the news feed from The Stork site.
item.content:encoded:
Well, I have your cold medicine addled noggin to thank for reminding me to add contact information to the site! I got so wrapped up in the launch of The Stork that I forgot to add that page.

Stork wallpaper can definitely happen. Give me some time to put that together.

Yes, I have considered a Facebook page for The Stork. Originally, I wanted the official Stork site to be the main source of Stork info so I wan’t sure I wanted a Facebook page as well. But it wouldn’t be too hard to set up a Facebook page that pulls the news feed from The Stork site.

item.title: Comment on The Stork has launched! by Doctor Checkmate
item.dc:creator: Doctor Checkmate
item.content:encoded:
Just ordered two copies of the Stork from IPR, and I want to tell more people about it. I’m a gamer, a sociologist obsessed with crowd sourcing and flash mobs), and a philosopher (I concentrated my studies in ethics). So, you can imagine, when I discovered the Stork I about exploded!

I am contacting you here because my cold medicine addled noggin won’t allow me to find a proper contact button or email. And, cause I would love a Stork wallpaper. Preferably that looked like the what is the stork website, but the image attached to this post would be excellent, too. The point being, I often have my laptop in a public place and I would love to have people ask me about the wall paper… Maybe something with a pulpy adventure font: “WHAT IS THE STORK?”

Any way, one last thing, have you considered a Facebook page for The Stork?
